subject: Politics
title: The Fourth Estate
description: A fast breakdown of The Fourth Estate for builders.

hook.text: The press is called the fourth estate â€” an unofficial branch of government that checks the other three.

buildup.text: Free media holds power accountable. It exposes corruption, informs voters, and shapes public debate.

discovery.text: The Watergate scandal brought down a president because two journalists followed the evidence.

twist.text: Media can also be a weapon. Propaganda disguised as news has started wars and toppled democracies.

climax.text: Without free media, citizens can't make informed choices. Democracy depends on independent journalism.

punchline.text: Free press protects democracy. Kill the press and democracy follows.

quiz.question: Why is the press called the 'fourth estate'?
options: It acts as an unofficial check on the three branches of government
It is the fourth branch of government under the constitution
It was the fourth industry to be regulated
